intro: Leptomeria squarrulosa, commonly known as the squarrulous sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its flowers, which are often pale pink or white, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators. Leptomeria squarrulosa is a low-growing perennial that forms dense mats, making it an important component of its native ecosystems.
